Title: Designing for behavioral change: Transforming of rural home into tourism facilities
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Interior Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sofiana, Y., Interior Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Travel to rural areas provides a different experience for tourists by offering a lifestyle in rural areas. One of them is by providing an experience of staying with the villagers (homestay). However, the demands of tourists for homestay facilities will affect the behavior and habits of the village community. How the adaptability of both parties changes the current behavior and lifestyle so that it can impact the design of facilities. The purpose of this paper is to identify the changes in behavior and lifestyle of both parties to initiate the design of tourist facilities in the homestay to meet the requirements of tourist attractions. The theories, a survey, and observation conducted were supported by literature reviews with a particular focus on existing facilities in the homestay. The study results have shown that behavioral and lifestyle adaptations from both parties make a positive contribution to initiate a proper design in a homestay by tourist standard. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Behavioral changes; Current behaviors; Literature reviews; Proper design; Tourist attractions; Rural areas
References: Lynch, P., The Commercial Home enterprise and host: A United Kingdon perspective (2005) International Journal of Hospitality, 24 (4), pp. 533-553; Cohen, E., Primitive and remote: Hill trekking in Thailand (1989) Annals of Tourism Research, 16 (1), pp. 30-61; Gu, M., Wong, P.P., Residents' perception of tourism impacts: A case study of homestay operators in Dachangshan Dao, North-East China (2006) Tourism Geo Graphies, 8 (3), pp. 253-273; Othman, F., Sazali, F., Mohammed, B., Rural and community-based tourism development in Malaysia: Prospects for homestays as a social economy enterprise (2013) TEAM Journal of Hospitality Tourism, 10, pp. 65-76; Dolezal, Community-based tourism in Thailand: (Dis-)illusions of authenticity and the necessity for dynamic concepts of culture and power (2011) SEAS: Austrian Journal of South-East Asian Studies, 4, pp. 129-138; Kimaiga, R.K., Kihima, B.O., Pepela, A.W., The role of homestay operators knowledge and skills in enhancing their business (2015) Journal of Tourism Research & Hospitality, 4 (2), pp. 2-11; Susanti, R., (2016) Kopi Gunung Puntang Dari Jawa Barat Juarai Kontes SCAA di Atlanta, , https://regional.kompas.com/read/2016/04/22/07100011/kopi.Gunung.Puntang.dari.Jawa.Barat.Juarai.Kontes.SCAA.di.Atlanta.AS, AS. Authors: Caroline O.S., Meliana S., Fajarwati A.A.S., Sofiana Y.
Title: Nostalgic element to support the sustainable reasons for architecture preservation - Case study Metropole XXI, Jakarta
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Interior Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Caroline, O.S., Interior Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Meliana, S., Interior Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fajarwati, A.A.S., Interior Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sofiana, Y., Interior Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: There are some reasons as a background for preserving the architecture building, one of them is nostalgic reason, "Old buildings have intrinsic value and are reminders of a city's culture and complexity [1]. The nostalgic reasons is refer to a feeling or inspiring nostalgia [2]. The architecture and interior elements are among that create the nostalgic reasons of one place. Using mixed methodology between qualitative and quantitative, this research aims to overview the architecture, interior and some famous food that people remember about Metropole XXI building in Jakarta. The research found that some architecture and interior elements are among of what people remember about Metropole XXI as nostalgic reason that could help for future research on preserving this building as one of the oldest and well maintain historical building in Jakarta. The research also found that the nostalgic reason would lead to sustainable design for architecture and interior works because of its strong bond to the people who has their emotional closeness. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: architecture preservation; historical architecture; Metropole XXI; nostalgic element; sustainable reason
Index Keywords: Architecture; Sustainable development; Historical architectures; Historical buildings; Interior works; Jakarta; Metropole XXI; nostalgic element; Old buildings; sustainable reason; Historic preservation

Authors: Sofiana Y., Wahidiyat M., Sylvia Caroline O.
Title: Bamboo as sustainable material for furniture design in disaster and remote areas in Indonesia
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: School of Design, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl.K.H. Syahdan No.9, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sofiana, Y., School of Design, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl.K.H. Syahdan No.9, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wahidiyat, M., School of Design, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl.K.H. Syahdan No.9, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sylvia Caroline, O., School of Design, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl.K.H. Syahdan No.9, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Bamboo has been known as a sustainable material for architecture, but only used on a small scale for furniture. However, even though it a sustainable resource, many people considered Bamboo as outcast material for furniture because of its appearance. Evidently, the use of bamboo is often used to make simple tools with similar traditional designs for everyday life. The tradition of using bamboo was not further explored with respect to the ongoing development of creative design and function in the era of today's modern technology. In retrospect to the above issues, this study is aimed to introduce the used of bamboo for material furniture in disaster and remote areas in Indonesia to increases their quality of life. It uses a research by a method of collecting data through surveys, literature review, interviews and training to determine the types of bamboo used for material furniture in disaster and remote territories. The results of this study is intended to show that the use of bamboo can be further developed into furniture for disaster and remote territory to create higher values of the products and increase the quality of life. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Disasters; Creative design; Furniture design; Literature reviews; Modern technologies; Quality of life; Remote areas; Sustainable materials; Sustainable resources; Bamboo
References: Sonjaya, J.A., (2014) Kumpulan Materi Pelatihan Bambu. Authors: Sofiana Y., Sylvia C.O., Purbasari M.
Title: Potential of bamboo as material for furniture in rural area in Indonesia
Affiliations: School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sofiana, Y., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sylvia, C.O., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Purbasari, M., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: People in Indonesia have a long history and tradition of using bamboo, which is grown across the archipelago. The plant has multiple uses and can re-generate by itself ensuring its continuity to meet ongoing needs. However, the tradition of using bamboo is not further explored in respect to the progressive development of creative design and function in the era of today’s modern technology. Evidently, the use of bamboo in rural areas is often used to make simple tools with similar traditional designs for everyday life. In retrospect to the above issues, this study is aimed to introduce the used of bamboo for material furniture in rural area in Indonesia. It uses a research by method of collecting data through surveys, literature review, interviews and training to determine the types of bamboo use for material furniture in rural area. The results of this study is intended to show that the use of bamboo can be further developed into furniture for rural areas to create higher values. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Bamboo; Characteristic of bamboo; Material furniture; Rural area
Funding Text 1: Acknowledgment submitted to Binus University for supporting the writing of this paper and hopefully this paper can be useful for the readers and contributed to the development of bamboo furniture in Indonesia.
